meanings.definition: Toadyisms: the practice of behaving in a servile or obsequious manner in order to gain favor or advantage
meanings.sent1: Her constant toadyisms towards the boss were transparent to everyone in the office.
meanings.sent2: The politician's success was often attributed to the toadyisms he received from his supporters.
meanings.sent3: Despite his toadyisms, he never truly gained the respect he craved.
meanings.sent4: The toadyisms of the courtiers were like a symphony of insincere praise.
meanings.sent5: The toadyisms in the workplace created a toxic environment of false flattery.

meanings.sent1: She saw through his toadyisms and knew he was just seeking personal gain.
meanings.sent2: The toadyisms of the salesperson were so excessive that they became laughable.
meanings.sent3: His toadyisms at the party made everyone uncomfortable with his insincerity.
meanings.sent4: The toadyisms of the celebrity entourage were as fake as their smiles.
meanings.sent5: The toadyisms of the students towards the teacher were met with raised eyebrows.
